item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Reveals 3 New Maps Coming in Season 1
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Season 1 of Black Ops 6 starts on November 14.
  • It will introduce three new maps: Extraction, Heirloom, and Hideout.
  • Heirloom is a small-scale map primarily meant for 2v2 Gunfight.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 has pulled the curtain back on three new multiplayer maps coming to the game as part of Season 1. Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 has already enjoyed a great deal of success in its pre-season, but now all eyes are on Season 1 and everything it will have to offer Call of Duty fans.

Notably, Season 1 will see Black Ops 6 integrated with the Warzone battle royale, offering gamers more unity between the two experiences. This will include the debut of the new Area 99 map, as well as the introduction of Black Ops 6 omnimovement. But while Season 1 means big things for Warzone , it also will have plenty of content added for fans of the traditional Call of Duty multiplayer experience.

Activision has given fans a look at three new multiplayer maps coming to Black Ops 6 with Season 1. Now, exact release dates for these maps have not been announced. It's possible all of them will be added when Season 1 goes live on November 14, but it's also possible that they will be spread throughout the season. Regardless, Black Ops 6 fans can look forward to two new core multiplayer maps, Hideout and Extraction, and a new Strike multiplayer map, Heirloom.

New Black Ops 6 Multiplayer Maps for Season 1

  • Extraction
  • Heirloom
  • Hideout

Black Ops 6 Strike maps can be used for 6v6 matches, but they are primarily built with 2v2 Gunfight in mind. No matter what multiplayer game mode Black Ops 6 fans prefer, Season 1 will be delivering some fresh environments to battle it out on. The maps themselves look interesting, though fans will have to get their hands on them before drawing any final conclusions.

Extraction appears to take place at a coastal hangar, complete with helicopters, while Heirloom is set in a museum. Finally, Hideout appears to be set on a military base. The existing Black Ops 6 multiplayer maps all have a great deal of personality, and it looks as though that design philosophy is carrying over to the Season 1 new additions.

Extraction, Heirloom, and Hideout aren't the first post-launch maps to be added to Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 . Fans of the game were just recently treated to the return of Nuketown, a fan favorite that first appeared in the original Black Ops from 2010. Nuketown's debut coincided with a Double XP weekend, so perhaps the same will hold true for the new maps added in Season 1.

item.title: Why Lies of P's Piecemeal DLC Reveals Work in Its Favor
item.description:
Lies of P was one of 2023’s most refreshing titles, and it was a unique entry alongside the ever-growing Soulslike genre. Basing its story and setting around Carlo Collodi’s iconic novel The Adventures of Pinocchio, Lies of P came during a particularly packed point in a loaded year for new games, yet still managed to carve its own audience. It was a critical and commercial darling and received numerous year-end award nominations and honors.

Naturally, when a game becomes as successful as Lies of P in today’s gaming landscape, players can fairly easily expect it to receive support with downloadable content in the future. In the case of Lies of P , though, developers Neowiz Games and Round8 Studio are still hard at work on the game’s first DLC, which has not seen a release even as the game has passed its first anniversary. In many ways, though, it’s great that the developers have chosen to piecemeal the DLC, and even though it will result in a lot of waiting, it should be worth it in the end.

Lies of P DLC Will Be Worth The Long Wait

Neowiz Gets To Polish The Lies of P DLC

Obviously, Neowiz and Round8 taking their time on Lies of P ’s DLC is good news, as it allows them to polish it up and make it as good as possible. Again, Lies of P was a very well-received game in 2023, which raises expectations for the developer’s future releases. With how polished the base game was, it’s fair to expect that any follow-up reaches the original version’s level of polish.

Thus, Neowiz and Round8 are best served taking all the time they need with Lies of P ’s DLC. After all, even if Neowiz is a fairly large team with over 1,000 developers, this is still a self-published indie game, meaning the team has to work on everything with no oversight and no outside publisher’s financial backing. It’s fair that Neowiz and Round8 will be protective of their game, and ensure that its DLC expansion will come out swinging just as hard as the base game.

There Are Plenty Of Soulslikes To Play Anyway

Equally, Lies of P ’s DLC taking a while is not a big deal given the current state of the Soulslike market. When the game was released last year, it dropped in the middle of a particularly bloated market for new Soulslikes, with titles like Wild Hearts , Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty , and Star Wars Jedi: Survivor releasing throughout the year. That number has only grown in 2024, with titles like Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree and Black Myth: Wu Kong , alongside many Soulslike titles in the indie sphere making big noise.

Soulslike players have plenty to play at the moment, to the point where there might even be too much to play. Given that fans of the genre are spoiled for choice, it’s not like gamers will have nothing to play while Neowiz and Round8 work on new content. As a result, Lies of P ’s developers have all the time in the world to cook up the first DLC expansion.

Neowiz and Round8 are best served taking all the time they need with Lies of P ’s DLC.

Extra Time Helps Lies of P DLC Bridge The Gap To A Sequel

The extra time spent working on this DLC could also benefit Neowiz and Round8 if the duo decides to pursue a Lies of P sequel. Many modern games use their DLC expansions as a bridge between a game and its full-blown follow-up, and Lies of P could be no different. With the extra time the teams have had, they have every opportunity to test new gameplay elements that could be expanded on in a full sequel.

With how popular Lies of P was in 2023, the developers should work to live up to the standard they’ve set with the first game. Thus, while it may feel torturous waiting for the sequel to release, it’s for the best that the teams take as long as they need. After the original game set the bar fairly high, it’ll no doubt be exciting to see how much the DLC raises that bar.

item.title: Wizard101 Codes (November 2024)
item.description:
Wizard101 is a cool multiplayer fantasy RPG that hasn't bored players over the years, but rather has gathered and continues to grow a large fanbase. Here, you will play the role of wizarding students, whose education is full of unexpected events and dangers that you need to overcome.

To be ready for any challenge, you will need to properly improve your character, and Wizard101 codes can greatly help with this. Redeem them to get a bunch of free stuff and get significant benefits that will help you progress in the game more easily.

All Wizard101 Codes

Working Wizard101 Codes

  • SPOOKYSPIDERS1024 - Redeem this code to get Giant Spider and Spider Rider mounts for one day.

Expired Wizard101 Codes

There are currently no expired Wizard101 codes, so redeem active ones as soon as possible to avoid missing out on rewards.

Redeeming Wizard101 codes will bring you cool rewards that will greatly simplify the gameplay. Regardless of your progress in the game, take advantage of this opportunity, as new codes appear infrequently.

How to Redeem Codes for Wizard101

Redeeming Wizard101 codes if you are a beginner in video games can be quite confusing and time-consuming. To avoid this and quickly understand how it works, use our step-by-step guide:

  • Visit the official Wizard101 website.
  • Log in to the account from which you want to redeem the codes.
  • On the website, find and interact with the “Redeem Card or Code” option. It is located on the left side of the screen.
  • After doing so, you will open the redemption menu. There will be a captcha that you need to complete and a field to enter the code, so copy and paste it there.
  • Once you've done that, click on the green Submit button at the bottom right of the menu to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, a notification will appear on the screen with a list of rewards received. If it doesn't work, make sure you entered the code correctly and didn't make any capitalization mistakes.

How to Get More Wizard101 Codes

Just like with other free games, you can find more codes on the game's official social media, and luckily Wizard101 has plenty of them. By carefully monitoring each of them, it is highly likely that you will find fresh codes.

  • Official Wizard101 Discord server.
  • Official Wizard101 X account.
  • Official Wizard101 Facebook page.
  • Official Wizard101 TikTok account.
  • Official Wizard101 YouTube channel.
  • Official Wizard101 Instagram account.

Wizard101 is available on PC, Xbox, PlayStation, and Nintendo.

item.title: Why Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom May Have Changed the Series' Combat Forever
item.description: The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, offers a unique combat twist could signal broader changes for the series. Unlike previous games, Zelda uses indirect strategies, summoning echoes of objects and creatures to handle fights creatively. This system lets players repurpose non-combat echoes—like wind turbines or boxes—as combat disruptors, creating a versatile toolkit without the standard arsenal of weapons. Echoes of Wisdom’s puzzle-centric approach in combat introduces a new strategic layer, integrating Zelda’s distinct summoning abilities with practical problem-solving.

item.title: Black Ops 6: Best Multiplayer Maps
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Treyarch delivers diverse maps in Black Ops 6, from classic favorites to brand-new designs with unique mechanics.
  • Certain maps like Babylon and Derelict feature strategic advantages for quick close-combat and vantage points.
  • The maps in Black Ops 6 offer versatile gameplay experiences across small, medium, and large sizes for both new and experienced players.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is here, and gamers are diving headfirst (sideways and even backwards with the fresh omnimovement) into its intense multiplayer modes. OG Black Ops fans will appreciate the return of the familiar developer, Treyarch, and new players will have the opportunity to experience Black Ops like never before.

Treyarch has delivered a collection of maps that push the boundaries of the franchise, offering a perfect blend of classic Call of Duty favorites like the iconic Nuketown and destroyed to brand-new, never before seen maps. 16 multiplayer maps, 12 core maps, and 4 strike maps offer a diverse range of combat scenarios, from tight, claustrophobic corridors to wide-open, long-range firefights for each mode. Here are the best maps in Black Ops 6 and what makes them so special.

10 Babylon

Ancient Ruins, Modern Warfare

  • Small Sized Map
  • Available in Multiplayer and Core Modes
  • Perfect for close-combat and intense firefights

Babylon transports players to ancient ruins and places them in history, as the name suggests. It features four broken-down central pillars that players can climb on top of to snipe their opponents easily. It's centralized location and vantage points make it great for those looking to partake in defensive gameplay.

This small map delivers quick gameplay and close-combat, but its lack of color and unique POIs leave it as a lower contender. Due to its smaller size, Babylon is a great map for players who want to get a game in when in a rush or looking to level up weapons quickly.

9 Lowtown

Dynamic Dockside Experience

  • Medium Sized Map
  • Available in Multiplayer and Core Modes
  • Multiple flanking and high vantage points for a versatile gaming experience

Players will find themselves swimming in the murky water to escape firefights in Lowtown. This riverside map is a neighborhood turned into a deadly battlefield. While not a top contender due to its size and lack of diverse large POIs, Lowdown is a potential hotspot for intense combat and to enjoy new omnimovement features.

Players will find themselves cutting edges and corners to escape enemies in team Deathmatch and Kill Confirmed. Lowtown's small shops and large river make it a great map to escape firefights quickly. While it may be a strategic play, it just misses the mark on entertainment.

8 Vorkuta

A Call Of Duty: Black Ops Original Returns

  • Medium Sized Map
  • Available in Multiplayer and Core Modes
  • Originally Appeared in Call of Duty: Black Ops Story, great for flanking and POI rotation

Revived from the dead, Vorkuta is back. Black Ops fans are sure to remember this cold, brutal Siberian prison. First introduced in the original Black Ops campaign, Vorkuta has plenty of vantage points, cover, and POIs for players looking to have fun.

Here, gamers will find their blood pumping at every turn. Great for long, offensive modes like Hardpoint, Kill Confirmed and Domination, Vorkuta is versatile and keeps players intrigued. This mid-sized map is perfect for close combat and flanking opponents. Whether ambushing foes in the wreckage or shooting them down with a high-impact sniper from a vantage point, players are sure to enjoy the thrill of this freezing cold map.

7 Gala

High-Stakes, High Combat

  • Small Sized Map
  • Available in Faceoff Strike Modes
  • For intense gaming, every move counts on this map

American flags adorning the ceiling, bright red, white, and blue, Gala is beaming the American Dream. Gala takes place in a fundraising gala in Washington, DC. This small map feels larger than life due to its high ceilings, oval formation, and podium platform for players to get a vantage point in strike modes.

Players will need to use strategy and tactical gameplay to win on this map. An ode to revolutionizing gameplay, Gala delivers on the promise of keeping Black Ops fresh.

6 Vault

High Class Combat

  • Medium Sized Map
  • Available in Multiplayer and Core Modes
  • Multiple vantage points across three levels

Players will feel the realistic effects of the aftermath of a Black Ops raid in Vault. This high-class, Middle Eastern map features a destroyed vault and an open spacious palace. The map's open layout, combined with the destroyed sections of the palace, pool, and vault, creates dynamic and unpredictable gameplay.

Be cautious and weary of snipers lurking on the second floor balcony. Players can make a mistake and become an easy target for long-range and sniper-equipped enemies while holding down the main central palace floor if not too careful.

5 Derelict

An Abandoned Train And Lush Overgrowth Greenery

  • Small Sized Map
  • Available in Multiplayer and Core Modes
  • Perfect for ambushing players and unexpected vantage points in combat

Derelict throws players into an almost post-apocalyptic map with plenty of hiding spots, vantage spots, and beneficial positions. This gritty map features a broken-down train and lush forest overgrowth, making it a visual masterpiece alongside its positional advantages.

Featuring five major POIs, Derelict is great for a variety of modes: Team Deathmatch, Domination, and Search and Rescue. Derelict's setting provides a unique and atmospheric backdrop for intense combat. The map welcomes both short and long-range combat opportunities, appealing to players who prefer strategy. Just be careful not to stay on the train too long and become an easy target.

4 Rewind

90s Nostalgia Hits Hard

  • Medium Sized Map
  • Available in Multiplayer and Core Modes
  • For taking cover or large rotations, this is a versatile map for various playstyles

Rewind or Blockbuster? This 1990s reminiscent map features a red video store, various retail stores and restaurants, and tons of open space for combat. It also features a main strip with cars for taking cover, making it the perfect map for a variety of multiplayer modes.

This map is pure fun, the open space is great for rushing opponents, the vantage point above the chicken restaurant is great for Infected, and the indoor retail stores are perfect for sneak attacking opponents. Gamers are likely to find themselves wishing to rewind and play this map over and over again.

3 Warhead

Nuketown's Destroyed Little Brother

  • Small Sized Map
  • Available in Multiplayer, Core and Strike Modes
  • Perfect for close-cornered combat and circling enemies

Nuketown is a fan favorite, and Warhead is even better. The 1950s bright architecture and the signature yellow school bus are still featured, honing its iconic originator. Available in multiple modes, the small-sized map is perfect for close quarter combat and offensive gameplay.

Warhead allows players to utilize all the weapons in the game, but SMGs are especially great for aggressive pushing and sniping from elevated positions. This strategic flexibility makes Warhead a thrilling and dynamic experience for new and experienced players alike.

2 Skyline

A Luxury Resort Reigns Supreme

  • Medium Sized Map
  • Available in Multiplayer and Core Modes
  • Perfect for fighting in close corners and in the open, allowing for versatile play

Set in a luxury, penthouse resort, Skyline is eerily reminiscent of Black Ops 2 's fan favorite map, Hijack. While Hijack was featured on a yacht, Skyline is the next destination. Featuring large open hallways, modern equipment, and stunning visuals, Skyline is a fun play for all modes.

It's open floorplan and multiple levels make for intense close-quarter and long-range combat. It allows players to hide out in the elevator shaft or at the turn of a hallway and rush players unexpectedly. When played right, gamers can dominate the map's center with a customized primary weapon and tactical equipment to control enemies.

1 Payback

A Multi-Level Mansion Makes For A Unique Experience

  • Small Sized Map
  • Available in Multiplayer and Core Modes
  • Various elevations and rooms make this great for all types of combat and playstyles

This fresh new map caters to every playstyle and feels oddly familiar, serving as an homage to the Black Ops series. This Bulgarian mountain mansion is a hidden gem, literally. Payback takes the top spot and doesn't fall short on gameplay. This map may be one of the smallest, but it packs a punch. Visually stunning and loaded with intense power positions, Payback is an easy winner for any game mode - whether that be Team Deathmatch or Search and Rescue.

Featuring an outdoor and indoor play area, Payback is great for long-range and short-range play. Players can escape situations quickly by jumping out of windows or spook enemies by creeping up staircases. Either way, it's guaranteed to be a fun play.
